channel.title: Energy & environment on City of San Diego Open Data Portal
channel.description: Recent content in Energy & environment on City of San Diego Open Data Portal

item.title: Bike Master Plan
item.description: Major infrastructure in the Bike Master Plan adopted in January 2014.

item.title: Bike route lines
item.description: Existing (2015) Bike facilities in the San Diego Region. This dataset was developed for the primary purpose of updating the SANDAG San Diego Regional Bike Map and the interactive bike map on the iCommute website.

item.title: Drinking Water Sample Sites
item.description: Locations of sampling sites for the drinking water system. These locations exist to fulfill the federal Total Coliform Rule.

item.title: Monitoring of Indicator Bacteria in Drinking Water
item.description: Here are individual test results from the water monitoring database, plus the monthly totals reported to the state to demonstrate MCL compliance. This dataset does not include results of tests for chemical parameters.

item.title: Monitoring of Select Chemical Parameters in Drinking Water
item.description: Results of tests on drinking water for alkalinity, color, turbidity, hardness, conductivity, total dissolved solids, and for selected anions.

item.title: Multi-Habitat Planning Areas
item.description: The Multi-Habitat Planning Area is planned habitat preserve. Of the 56,831 acres, 90 percent is targeted for preservation. Within this area, development is limited, but the public is allowed access in many areas for recreational activities.
